page.title: 04TAKELEYS FRUIT FARM
page.content: Takeleys farm on the outskirts of Epping Upland is a fairly small farm by local standards and has developed since 1978 as a fruit and vegetable farm.Over the last 20 years labour for fruit picking has become harder to find:the roving casual workers are fewer and find it hard to avoid tax on their earnings.Takeleys has instead encouraged people to pick their own fruit and vegetables,paying much lower prices for fresher food for their freezers.90% of their produce is sold this way:only 10% are picked and sent to market. Fruit grown include strawberries and raspberries, while vegetables grown include peas,broad beans, french beans and courgettes.
